intro: Ardisia purseglovei var. purseglovei, commonly known as the Seychelles ardisia, is a flowering plant native to the Seychelles Islands. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, dark red berries. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. It produces fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, adding to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
